item.title: Hey Guys
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I’m not really big on online casinos. I bet online all the time, at least two or three times a week for a good few hours but I hate the online casinos, it’s too easy to lose money to idiots. I prefer going to the casino and doing whats known as “spotting” over here, dunno if it’s the same over in the US. Basically looking for the obvious drunks and newbies and take their money from them.

Read full topic

item.title: Hey Guys
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Bowser jr:

Did you take card counting into consideration when calculating the odds earlier?

No that is just baseline. So for instance if you count cards on a 6 deck shoe your odds come closer to 50/50. If you count cards on 1 deck blackjack then the odds are actually slightly in your favor.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr

Did you take card counting into consideration when calculating the odds earlier?

Read full topic

item.title: Hey Guys
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:31, topic:515787”][quote author=Newty link=topic=634044.msg4282192#msg4282192 date=1365819028]

Poker is the only way to beat the odds, any other casino games are waste of money.
Do anyone have any good tip for wining (win more money than you lose) on online poker boards?

If you play single deck blackjack the house odds are .15% in their favour. 6 deck blackjack pushes those odds to ~1.5% in the favour of the house. So its pretty much a flip of the coin on who wins. Also, if you can find a single deck game then even an idiot can count cards and know when to bet high/low. The problem is not many places use a single deck anymore.

But I do agree that poker is the way to beat the casino!
[/quote]
If you try to count cards, I bet they would kick you out pretty quickly? (It should be possible to do with a 6 deck game, if they don’t shuffle between every deal.)[/quote]

Yeah if they caught you theyd kick you out for sure. Sure its also possible on a 3 or 6 card shoe but it takes a bit more work obviously. Not to mention like jme said most of the time your count is near 0 and it takes multiple people at different tables to find a count that is really favorable. But the 1 deck game takes care of that because the count can swing in your favor so fast compared to a 6 deck shoe where 1 card is a much lower percentage of the shoe.

Also jme I’ve won like $200 on video blackjack but I’m also of the opinion its ‘rigged’. They do shuffle every hand and that reduces your odds exponentially lol

Read full topic

item.title: Hey Guys
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:30, topic:515787”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=634044.msg4282061#msg4282061 date=1365802860]
Poker is the only way to beat the odds, any other casino games are waste of money.
Do anyone have any good tip for wining (win more money than you lose) on online poker boards?
[/quote]

If you play single deck blackjack the house odds are .15% in their favor. 6 deck blackjack pushes those odds to ~1.5% in the favor of the house. So its pretty much a flip of the coin on who wins. Also, if you can find a single deck game then even an idiot can count cards and know when to bet high/low. The problem is not many places use a single deck anymore.

But I do agree that poker is the way to beat the casino! :)[/quote]

The equation for triple decks is also simple enough for an idiot. Counting cards is lame though. The majority of the time your count ends up somewhere near 0, which leaves you with no insight on whats left in the deck. Thats why in the movie 21 they had people at multiple tables waiting for a high count. Seems so risky.

Read full topic

If you play single deck blackjack the house odds are .15% in their favour. 6 deck blackjack pushes those odds to ~1.5% in the favour of the house. So its pretty much a flip of the coin on who wins. item.title: Hey Guys
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:23, topic:515787”]Poker is the only way to beat the odds, any other casino games are waste of money.
Do anyone have any good tip for wining (win more money than you lose) on online poker boards?[/quote]

If you play single deck blackjack the house odds are .15% in their favor. 6 deck blackjack pushes those odds to ~1.5% in the favor of the house. So its pretty much a flip of the coin on who wins. Also, if you can find a single deck game then even an idiot can count cards and know when to bet high/low. The problem is not many places use a single deck anymore.

But I do agree that poker is the way to beat the casino!

Read full topic

item.title: Hey Guys
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

They gave us some papers on it, but half the requirements aren’t actually listed on it. But yes, I’d rather it be done in a better environment than a free-for-all in the gym.

Read full topic

item.title: Hey Guys
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Sounds unfair to me. Picking classes should be individualized and in more of a personal environment, in my opinion. I’m not sure about anyone else, but my school hands out pamphlets that show prerequisites to each class, how long each class is, what it consists of, credits earned, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Hey Guys
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:26, topic:515787”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=634044.msg4282161#msg4282161 date=1365815901]
Shitty. Had to set up my schedule for senior year and whatnot, my school does it really poorly.
[/quote]
What makes it so poor? Are your options restricted or are there more requirements for graduation, etc?[/quote]
It’s all done in the gym and the teachers sit in a giant ring. The idiotic part is they don’t tell you what classes are required to take other classes, so I spent 2 hours re-arranging mine around since half my classes needed some other class I didn’t take.

Plus it’s just kind of setup so you have to join some kind of club or activity at the beginning or filling up your schedule will be a bitch and a half.

Read full topic

item.title: Hey Guys
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

how KroniKz_ makes his bills:

get a friend to flip a quarter, tell a kid that you can guess heads or tails everytime and never lose. Tell him if you don’t get it x amount of times in a row he owes you $5 vise versa. Now when your friend flips the quarter and has his hand over the quarter, heads he will look at the cieling real quick, tails he will look down.

true MC since 96
